name: Artur Piskorski
gap_analysis:
Strongest candidate technically. Explicit mention of Modbus, MQTT, RTOS, and Linux. Claims 'autorskie projekty' (author's projects) and full system design. 

**Gap**: No public GitHub found despite claims of 'autorskie projekty'. Verification of code quality is missing.
search_findings: Search for 'Artur Piskorski' yielded no specific programming profile. Candidate likely works on private/local projects or under a different handle.
other: Extensive hardware+software integration in OZE projects, strong IoT, free/open source stack, low-code.
comment: Most closely matches advanced sectoral/Modbus/OZE/EMS needs in direct experience; some focus on open source/no-code stack.

validation_status.justification: Direct experience with distributed energy network management, Modbus TCP/RTU, LiFePO4 battery storage project, mobile app for OZE monitoring, and ESP32/Linux integration. Cover letter explicitly targets this exact position and demonstrates understanding of IEC standards for energy systems.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Self-taught entrepreneur and maker who has transitioned from fiber optic network building to IoT and energy systems. Demonstrates end-to-end project ownership: from PCB design and embedded C (RTOS, ~3000 LOC) to mobile app development and cloud integration. Has a clear vision for distributed energy systems with security (IEC 62443, IEC 62351). Not a traditional 'corporate' engineer—more of a hands-on prototyper and integrator.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Fits the profile of a startup/scaleup environment well. Comfortable with ambiguity, building MVPs, and working across the stack. May require structure for larger, process-heavy projects.

interview_strategy: Walk me through a specific debugging scenario in your energy storage project. What tools did you use (GDB, oscilloscope, serial logs)?
How would you design a multithreaded Modbus polling loop in C for 10+ devices with different response times?
Describe how you would structure a codebase for a multi-component EMS with unit tests and CI.

technical_hard_skills: Self-built LiFePO4 storage with own BMS software (C, FreeRTOS)
Direct Modbus RTU/TCP and MQTT integration with industrial devices
Mobile app (no-code) with Firebase, REST API, real-time monitoring
Fiber optic network deployment (2011-2023) indicates infrastructure know-how
soft_skills_culture: Strong written communication (cover letter cites specific IEC standards)

gap_analysis_detailed: No explicit POSIX/pthread experience documented (could be implicit in Linux work)
No formal academic background in software (polytechnic: incomplete, technical school)
Limited evidence of GCC/GDB use (embedded/RTOS likely uses it, but not stated)
May need mentorship on code quality and large-project process

name: Kamil Godek
gap_analysis:
Strong academic background (AGH) and embedded projects (STM32, Camera 3D). Good C/Python mix. 

**Gap**: Lack of specific Energy/Modbus experience. GitHub link provided in CV but not indexed by broad search.
search_findings: CV lists github.com/KamilGodek. Search confirmed presence of 'Kamil Godek' in academic/project contexts (AGH).
comment: Strong C/Embedded/Modbus/TCP skillset; no explicit OZE/EMS or sector projects mentioned.

validation_status.justification: Strong C/Python/embedded background, TCP/IP, PCB, STM32. Familiar with industrial automation (ELPLC, Cognex camera integration, robot communication). Has worked with Modbus (not explicitly OZE). No direct energy sector or storage project experience.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Embedded developer with electronics background (MSc Electronics/Telecom, AGH). Experience in both industrial automation (machine vision, robot integration) and AI/ML for vision. Strong in low-level C and Python, CAD/PCB, and diagnostics. LinkedIn confirms active job search and embedded/AI focus.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Good for technical deep dives and hands-on integration. Not a domain expert in energy, but can transfer skills. May need domain mentorship.

interview_strategy: How would you approach integrating a new Modbus device (e.g., a smart meter) into an existing EMS?
Walk me through your TCP/IP server implementation for the Cognex camera—what challenges did you face?
How would you manage real-time data flow from 20+ inverters in a distributed PV network?

technical_hard_skills: Cognex 3D-A5030 vision, TCP/IP server for robot communication
soft_skills_culture: LinkedIn: active job seeker, clear technical profile

gap_analysis_detailed: No explicit OZE, PV, or energy storage project experience
No POSIX/pthread experience mentioned
Embedded work is on microcontrollers, not Linux system programming
Recent work is warehouse logistics (temporary), not engineering

name: Magdalena Nowakowska
gap_analysis:
Very senior profile (JDG since 2020, diverse history). Strong C/Linux/Pthreads foundation. 

**Gap**: Heavy focus on Web/PHP/SQL in recent years might mean C skills are rusty. No direct Energy sector experience mentioned.
search_findings: No public LinkedIn found. Profile suggests a seasoned freelancer/contractor.
other: Project manager, analytic background, some business app focus
comment: Strong system programming, Linux, and C/POSIX background; no explicit energy or Modbus/OZE/EMS experience.

validation_status.justification: Strong C and Linux background, explicit POSIX/pthreads experience, network programming (sockets, WebSockets). However, no direct energy sector, Modbus, or hardware integration experience. Would need to learn domain, but has the core systems skills.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Experienced C/PHP developer with academic (MSc Informatics) and industrial background (telecom, enterprise apps, budgetary systems). Strong analytical skills, project management, and code design. Publications in IT/logistics suggest academic rigor. Primarily a software person, not a hardware integrator.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Good for structured, documentation-heavy projects. May not be as comfortable in rapid prototyping or maker-style environments. Strong process and quality orientation.

interview_strategy: How would you approach learning a new industrial protocol (like Modbus) with limited documentation?
Describe a project where you had to integrate software with external hardware or real-world systems.
Walk me through how you debug race conditions in a multithreaded C application.
gap_analysis_detailed: No energy sector, OZE, Modbus, or hardware integration experience
No embedded systems or PCB/device work
Would need significant onboarding into the domain

name: Ihor Horalevych
gap_analysis:
Perfect domain fit (Energy, PLC, SCADA, Electrical qualifications). 

**Gap**: Primary experience is Automation/PLC, not C programming (C99/POSIX). He is an Automatyk, not a Software Engineer.
search_findings: Confirmed background in Automation/Energy via CV details.
comment: Very extensive automation and hardware integration experience, less emphasis on OZE or PV. No explicit Modbus/EMS in CV, but has SCADA and PLC.

validation_status.justification: Extensive automation/PLC/SCADA/microcontroller background (40+ years), C and assembly for embedded, project design, telemetry. However, no explicit OZE, Modbus, or EMS experience. Energy-adjacent (HVAC, heating, pumping), but not directly in solar/storage.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Highly experienced automation engineer (since 1983), with deep expertise in industrial control, SCADA, PLC, and embedded systems. Has run own automation company. Experience in HVAC, food/beverage, CNC, and industrial production. Not a software developer in the modern sense—more of a control systems integrator.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: May be overqualified for junior/mid roles, but could be valuable for system design and hardware integration. Polish B1, Ukrainian/Russian fluent. May need adaptation to modern software practices (Git, CI/CD).

interview_strategy: Describe a project where you integrated serial communication (RS-485, Modbus RTU) with a SCADA system.
How would you adapt your PLC/SCADA experience to a Linux-based energy management platform?
What is your experience with version control and collaborative code development?

technical_hard_skills: TIA Portal, CoDeSys, GX Works, Automation Studio, SIMATIC WinCC, Pc-Vue
STM32, FPGA, PCB design (EasyEDA, Altium, PCAD)

gap_analysis_detailed: No explicit Modbus, OZE, or EMS experience
No Git, GCC, GDB or modern Linux system programming
May be less familiar with modern software engineering workflows
OLX-generated CV lacks detail (use main CV instead)

name: Jakub Sobczuk
gap_analysis:
Student. C++ and Java experience, but lacks C/Embedded specifics. 

**Gap**: No commercial experience, no energy domain knowledge.
other: Student, some C work in university projects, mainly full stack/admin
comment: Basic programming and Linux, but not senior/industry relevant for advanced OZE/EMS position.

validation_status.justification: Student with some C, Linux, and server admin experience. No embedded, energy sector, or Modbus experience. Primarily web/fullstack orientation.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Currently a student at Warsaw Polytechnic (IT, 4th year, non-stationary). Also a professional soldier (cadet, air traffic control). C experience limited to university projects. Main strengths are in Java/.NET/JavaScript. Looking for internship or junior role.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Good attitude and discipline (military), but lacks depth for this position. Could be considered for a more junior or auxiliary role if company has bandwidth to mentor.

interview_strategy: Describe a university project where you used C and what challenges you faced.
How do you approach learning a new technical domain (e.g., energy systems)?
What is your availability for a full-time role given your military and student obligations?
gap_analysis_detailed: No industrial, embedded, or energy sector experience
No Modbus, POSIX, pthread, or hardware integration
Limited practical C experience

Student (1st year?). Basic C/C++. 

**Gap**: Too junior for the required position.
comment: Entry-level only. No relevant experience or advanced programming/system skills.

validation_status.justification: First-year IT student with only basic C/C++ and Linux exposure. No relevant project or work experience.

bigger_picture_narrative.narrative: Currently a first-year student at AGH (Technical Informatics). Strong math tutoring background, but no practical software engineering or systems experience.
bigger_picture_narrative.culture_fit: Not a fit for this role. May be suitable for internship or future consideration after more academic progress.

interview_strategy: Not recommended for interview for this position.
